author: Staff Reporter
text:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s public meeting here on February 2 will kick-start the party’s election campaign in Tamil Nadu, said H. Raja, national secretary of the party, here on Friday.

The party was engaged in talks with a few parties for an alliance.

The party would make public the details at an appropriate time.

There was no need for the party to announce its Chief Ministerial candidate.

After Amit Shah took charge as party president, there had been a focus on the southern States, particularly those going to the polls.

Corruption

The BJP would focus on corruption during the campaign in Tamil Nadu and promise a corruption-free government. It would be like the corruption-free government at the Centre.

He dismissed opinion polls as farce.

Mr. Raja denied that there was a link to the Union Government revoking the ban on jallikattu (since stayed by the Supreme Court), conferring actor Rajnikanth with a Padma award, and announcing Smart Cities.

Resignation

He sought the resignation of Kerala Chief Minister Oommen Chandy for his alleged role in the solar panel scam that has rocked the State.
title: Modi’s public meeting to kick-start poll campaign
